jobDescription: SUMMARY:Greets and directs visitors and participants in a positive manner. Operates telephone system to receive and direct incoming calls to proper party. Assists with data entry and programming for the Living Well, Aging Well program.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Receives participants and visitors, determines nature of visit and directs accordingly. Provides general information and referrals to inquiries, and acts as the welcome to Living well, Aging Well.Answers and directs incoming telephone calls. Takes accurate messages, retrieves and refers messages in a timely manner, and operates public announcement system.Maintains the front office area in an orderly manner. Maintains emergency and first aid kits supplies.Performs office duties such as distributing mail, filing, copying, disbursing forms to staff and participants, and data entry including the Living Well, Aging Well data.Collects fees including, but not limited to membership dues, classes, special events, and locker use.Keeps a variety of records such as logs related to petty cash intake, information for Commission on Aging, and consumer intake forms for Aquatic Park Center.Performs other work as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS:High School graduate or equivalent. Bachelor’s degree preferred. Minimum of two (2) years related general office including reception experience required.SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY: None
